intro: Lobelia leptostachys, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Lobelia leptostachys is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
